name: MuddyWater
descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) is a cyber espionage group assessed to be a subordinate element within Iran's Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS).(Citation: CYBERCOM Iranian Intel Cyber January 2022) Since at least 2017, [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has targeted a range of government and private organizations across sectors, including telecommunications, local government, defense, and oil and natural gas organizations, in the Middle East, Asia, Africa, Europe, and North America.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Bypass User Account Control
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) uses various techniques to bypass UAC.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)

subtechniques.name: Domain Account
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used cmd.exe net user /domain to enumerate domain users.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Web Services
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used file sharing services including OneHub, Sync, and TeraBox to distribute tools.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used HTTP for C2 communications.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used the native Windows cabinet creation tool, makecab.exe, likely to compress stolen data to be uploaded.(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has added Registry Run key KCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\SystemTextEncoding to establish persistence.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used PowerShell for execution.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: MuddyWater TrendMicro June 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used a custom tool for creating reverse shells.(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used VBScript files to execute its [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) payload, as well as macros.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: MuddyWater TrendMicro June 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has developed tools in Python including [Out1](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0594).(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used JavaScript files to execute its [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) payload.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Credentials from Password Stores

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has run tools including Browser64 to steal passwords saved in victim web browsers.(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has performed credential dumping with [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) and other tools, including by dumping passwords saved in victim email.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Standard Encoding
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used tools to encode C2 communications including Base64 encoding.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has stored a decoy PDF file within a victim's `%temp%` folder.(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has decoded base64-encoded PowerShell, JavaScript, and VBScript.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: MuddyWater TrendMicro June 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used AES to encrypt C2 responses.(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used C2 infrastructure to receive exfiltrated data.(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has exploited the Microsoft Exchange memory corruption vulnerability (CVE-2020-0688).(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has exploited the Office vulnerability CVE-2017-0199 for execution.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has exploited the Microsoft Netlogon vulnerability (CVE-2020-1472).(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that checked if the ProgramData folder had folders or files with the keywords "Kasper," "Panda," or "ESET."(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) maintains persistence on victim networks through side-loading dlls to trick legitimate programs into running malware.(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) can disable the system's local proxy settings.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that can upload additional files to the victim’s machine.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Component Object Model
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that has the capability to execute malicious code via COM, DCOM, and Outlook.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

subtechniques.name: Dynamic Data Exchange
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that can execute PowerShell scripts via DDE.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has disguised malicious executables and used filenames and Registry key names associated with Windows Defender.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Multi-Stage Channels
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used one C2 to obtain enumeration scripts and monitor web logs, but a different C2 to send data back.(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)

subtechniques.name: Steganography
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has stored obfuscated JavaScript code in an image file named temp.jpg.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)

subtechniques.name: Compile After Delivery
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used the .NET csc.exe tool to compile executables from downloaded C# code.(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)

subtechniques.name: Command Obfuscation
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used Daniel Bohannon’s Invoke-Obfuscation framework and obfuscated PowerShell scripts.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: GitHub Invoke-Obfuscation) The group has also used other obfuscation methods, including Base64 obfuscation of VBScripts and PowerShell commands.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: MuddyWater has used legitimate tools [ConnectWise](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0591), [RemoteUtilities](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0592), and SimpleHelp to gain access to the target environment.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: group-ib_muddywater_infra)

subtechniques.name: Office Template Macros
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used a Word Template, Normal.dotm, for persistence.(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has performed credential dumping with [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) and procdump64.exe.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: LSA Secrets
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has performed credential dumping with [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349).(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Cached Domain Credentials
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has performed credential dumping with [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349).(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has compromised third parties and used compromised accounts to send spearphishing emails with targeted attachments to recipients.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)	(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has sent targeted spearphishing e-mails with malicious links.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware to obtain a list of running processes on the system.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)

subtechniques.name: External Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has controlled [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) from behind a proxy network to obfuscate the C2 location.(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018) [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used a series of compromised websites that victims connected to randomly to relay information to command and control (C2).(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Remote Access Tools
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used legitimate applications ScreenConnect, AteraAgent and SimpleHelp to manage systems remotely and move laterally.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)(Citation: group-ib_muddywater_infra)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used scheduled tasks to establish persistence.(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that can capture screenshots of the victim’s machine.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Software Discovery

subtechniques.name: Security Software Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware to check running processes against a hard-coded list of security tools often used by malware researchers.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used a PowerShell backdoor to check for Skype connectivity on the target machine.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: CMSTP
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used CMSTP.exe and a malicious INF to execute its [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) payload.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)

subtechniques.name: Mshta
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used mshta.exe to execute its [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) payload and to pass a PowerShell one-liner for execution.(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

subtechniques.name: Rundll32
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that leveraged rundll32.exe in a Registry Run key to execute a .dll.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that can collect the victim’s OS version and machine name.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware to collect the victim’s IP address and domain name.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Connections Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used a PowerShell backdoor to check for Skype connections on the target machine.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that can collect the victim’s username.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has run a tool that steals passwords saved in victim email.(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has distributed URLs in phishing e-mails that link to lure documents.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has attempted to get users to open malicious PDF attachment and to enable macros and launch malicious Microsoft Word documents delivered via spearphishing emails.(Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)(Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022)(Citation: Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Bidirectional Communication
subtechniques.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used web services including OneHub to distribute remote access tools.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) has used malware that leveraged WMI for execution and querying host information.(Citation: Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: Talos MuddyWater May 2019)(Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)

software_data.name: ConnectWise
software_data.descr: (Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

software_data.name: CrackMapExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: TrendMicro POWERSTATS V3 June 2019)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

software_data.name: Koadic
software_data.descr: (Citation: Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017)(Citation: TrendMicro POWERSTATS V3 June 2019)

software_data.name: LaZagne
software_data.descr: (Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: TrendMicro POWERSTATS V3 June 2019)

software_data.name: Mimikatz
software_data.descr: (Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: TrendMicro POWERSTATS V3 June 2019)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

software_data.name: POWERSTATS
software_data.descr: (Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)(Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018)(Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: Small Sieve
software_data.descr: (Citation: DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2022)(Citation: NCSC GCHQ Small Sieve Jan 2022)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

alias_descriptions.name: Static Kitten
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

alias_descriptions.name: Seedworm
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

alias_descriptions.name: TEMP.Zagros
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018)(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)

ClearSky MuddyWater Nov 2018.description: ClearSky Cyber Security. (2018, November). MuddyWater Operations in Lebanon and Oman: Using an Israeli compromised domain for a two-stage campaign. Retrieved November 29, 2018.

ClearSky MuddyWater June 2019.description: ClearSky. (2019, June). Iranian APT group ‘MuddyWater’ Adds Exploits to Their Arsenal. Retrieved May 14, 2020.

CYBERCOM Iranian Intel Cyber January 202.description: Cyber National Mission Force. (2022, January 12). Iranian intel cyber suite of malware uses open source tools. Retrieved September 30, 2022.

DHS CISA AA22-055A MuddyWater February 2.description: FBI, CISA, CNMF, NCSC-UK. (2022, February 24). Iranian Government-Sponsored Actors Conduct Cyber Operations Against Global Government and Commercial Networks. Retrieved September 27, 2022.

Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017.description: Lancaster, T.. (2017, November 14). Muddying the Water: Targeted Attacks in the Middle East. Retrieved March 15, 2018.

Talos MuddyWater Jan 2022.description: Malhortra, A and Ventura, V. (2022, January 31). Iranian APT MuddyWater targets Turkish users via malicious PDFs, executables. Retrieved June 22, 2022.

Anomali Static Kitten February 2021.description: Mele, G. et al. (2021, February 10). Probable Iranian Cyber Actors, Static Kitten, Conducting Cyberespionage Campaign Targeting UAE and Kuwait Government Agencies. Retrieved March 17, 2021.

Microsoft Threat Actor Naming July 2023.description: Microsoft . (2023, July 12). How Microsoft names threat actors. Retrieved November 17, 2023.

Proofpoint TA450 Phishing March 2024.description: Miller, J. et al. (2024, March 21). Security Brief: TA450 Uses Embedded Links in PDF Attachments in Latest Campaign. Retrieved March 27, 2024.

Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021.description: Peretz, A. and Theck, E. (2021, March 5). Earth Vetala – MuddyWater Continues to Target Organizations in the Middle East. Retrieved March 18, 2021.

Reaqta MuddyWater November 2017.description: Reaqta. (2017, November 22). A dive into MuddyWater APT targeting Middle-East. Retrieved May 18, 2020.

FireEye MuddyWater Mar 2018.description: Singh, S. et al.. (2018, March 13). Iranian Threat Group Updates Tactics, Techniques and Procedures in Spear Phishing Campaign. Retrieved April 11, 2018.

Symantec MuddyWater Dec 2018.description: Symantec DeepSight Adversary Intelligence Team. (2018, December 10). Seedworm: Group Compromises Government Agencies, Oil & Gas, NGOs, Telecoms, and IT Firms. Retrieved December 14, 2018.

group-ib_muddywater_infra.description: Rostovcev, N. (2023, April 18). SimpleHarm: Tracking MuddyWater’s infrastructure. Retrieved July 11, 2024.

Securelist MuddyWater Oct 2018.description: Kaspersky Lab's Global Research & Analysis Team. (2018, October 10). MuddyWater expands operations. Retrieved November 2, 2018.

Talos MuddyWater May 2019.description: Adamitis, D. et al. (2019, May 20). Recent MuddyWater-associated BlackWater campaign shows signs of new anti-detection techniques. Retrieved June 5, 2019.

MuddyWater TrendMicro June 2018.description: Villanueva, M., Co, M. (2018, June 14). Another Potential MuddyWater Campaign uses Powershell-based PRB-Backdoor. Retrieved July 3, 2018.

GitHub Invoke-Obfuscation.description: Bohannon, D.. (2017, March 13). Invoke-Obfuscation - PowerShell Obfuscator. Retrieved June 18, 2017.

TrendMicro POWERSTATS V3 June 2019.description: Lunghi, D. and Horejsi, J.. (2019, June 10). MuddyWater Resurfaces, Uses Multi-Stage Backdoor POWERSTATS V3 and New Post-Exploitation Tools. Retrieved May 14, 2020.

NCSC GCHQ Small Sieve Jan 2022.description: NCSC GCHQ. (2022, January 27). Small Sieve Malware Analysis Report. Retrieved August 22, 2022.
